author: mobile@rds.ca ()
title: Richardson prend sa revanche sur Alfred à Zurich
text:
Sha'Carri Richardson prend sa revanche sur Julien Alfred à Zurich
La pluie en début de soirée puis le froid ont sapé jeudi soir les espoirs de grands records lors du meeting de Zurich, quand même marqué par des duels de haute volée en sprint et les victoires de Sha'Carri Richardson et de Letsile Tebogo.
Sur la piste détrempée du stade du Letzigrund, la flamboyante sprinteuse américaine, 2e du 100 m aux JO de Paris, s'est offert une petite revanche en battant la championne olympique Julien Alfred, pour sa première course depuis les Jeux.
En tête tout au long de la course, Alfred s'est fait souffler la victoire sur la ligne grâce à un retour canon de Richardson, flashée en 10 sec 84 (10,88 pour Alfred).
« Pour moi c'était une course formidable », a brièvement réagi Richardson après avoir célébré sa victoire.
À Paris le mois dernier, Richardson - la plus rapide sur la ligne droite cette saison (10,71) - était favorite pour décrocher l'or olympique mais avait dû se contenter de l'argent, largement battue par Alfred qui avait apporté la première médaille olympique de l'histoire de son pays Sainte-Lucie.
Le 200 m masculin offrait aussi un duel entre les deux premiers des JO, le Botswanais Letsile Tebogo et l'Américain Kenny Bednarek. Mais sans revanche puisque Tebogo a continué sa série de victoires de prestige en coupant la ligne en 19 sec 55, deux centièmes plus vite que Bednarek.
Duplantis sous les six mètres
La soirée n'a pas été marquée par de grosses performances, même si les champions olympiques présents (Mahuchikh à la hauteur, Crouser au poids, Holloway sur 110 m haies...) ont souvent tenu leur rang.
Le public suisse espérait un nouveau record du monde du côté de la perche avec Mondo Duplantis, mais le Suédois, pas aidé par la météo et fatigué après son improbable 100 m la veille, s'est arrêté à 5,82 m.
« Mon corps était brisé après la course d'hier et il faisait froid », a expliqué Duplantis, quand même vainqueur du concours même si c'est la première fois de l'été qu'il ne passe pas six mètres (hors qualifications)
Mercredi, le recordman du monde suédois (6,26 m) avait remporté un 100 m exhibition face au recordman du monde du 400 m haies, le Norvégien Karsten Warholm, un défi que les deux amis s'étaient lancé l'année dernière.
Le Suédois a gagné (10,37) et en guise de gage, le Norvégien a dû effectuer un « Walk of Shame » sur la piste avec un maillot suédois sur les épaules.
Chebet et Ingebrigtsen ratent les records
En demi-fond, la double championne olympique kényane Beatrice Chebet (5.000 m, 10.000 m) visait à Zurich le record du monde du 5.000 m (14:00.21).
Aidée jusqu'à la mi-course par une lièvre, elle a ensuite tenté de s'accrocher aux lumières de la « wavelight » en bord de piste mais elle a progressivement lâché le rythme pour finir en 14 min 09 sec 52.
« La météo n'était pas bonne pour une record du monde, a réagi Chebet. Je l'ai manqué et je pense que c'est à cause des conditions, et ma lièvre a lâché plus tôt que prévu. »
Sur 1500 m hommes, la "wavelight" indiquait également l'allure du record du monde mais là encore, personne n'a réussi à la suivre.
La course ressemblait pourtant à une grande explication entre les médaillés olympiques - l'Américain Cole Hocker, le Britannique Josh Kerr et Yared Nuguse - et le 4e Jakob Ingebrigtsen, éjecté du podium à Paris où il était pourtant favori.
Ingebrigtsen, malade la semaine dernière après avoir battu le record du monde du 3 000 m, a suivi dans un premier temps l'allure du record (3:26.00) mais a finalement lâché et s'est fait doubler dans les derniers mètres par Yuguse, vainqueur en 3 min 29 sec 21 (3:29.52 pour Ingebrigtsen).

author: Sentinel Digital Desk
title: CM Himanta Biswa Sarma: 88,080 Jobs Provided; 26,000 More in the Offing - Sentinelassam
text: CM Himanta Biswa Sarma: 88,080 Jobs Provided; 26,000 More in the Offing On the eve of the New Year, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said that his government provided 88,080 government jobs to the youth of the state until 2023, and 26,000 other jobs are on the offing. STAFF REPORTER GUWAHATI: On the eve of the New Year, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said that his government provided 88,080 government jobs to the youth of the state until 2023, and 26,000 other jobs are on the offing. The [Chief Minister](https://www.sentinelassam.com/topheadlines/agreement-includes-rights-of-indigenous-people-assam-cm-himanta-biswa-sarma-683782) wrote on X (formerly Twitter): “In the year 2023, we have created a milestone in providing jobs to the youth of Assam. Over 44,000 appointment letters were distributed in a single day by honourable Home Minister Shri Amit Shah ji in May 2023.” The Chief Minister further said that his government would fulfil the promise of providing one lakh government jobs to the youth of Assam. On Mission Basundhara 2.0, the Chief Minister said that the government has settled 2,82,106 bigha, three katha, and nine lessas of land in the Brahmaputra Valley and 21 bigha, eight kathas, one chatak, and two gonda in the Barak Valley so far. Meanwhile, the Chief Minister wished the people of the state a happy and prosperous New Year. He hopes that the state will make strides quickly amidst peace and harmony among all communities, faiths, and linguistic groups. He also appealed to the people to dedicate themselves to the journey of the development of the state with their best contribution. Also Read: [PM Narendra Modi brainstorms on good governance with chief secretaries of states](https://www.sentinelassam.com/topheadlines/pm-narendra-modi-brainstorms-on-good-governance-with-chief-secretaries-of-states-684006) Also Watch:

author: Zarmena Khan
title: 30th Anniversary DualSense Sticks Might Not Be Easy to Replace
text:
Now that the PlayStation 30th anniversary products have launched, players are pointing out some minor oversights, including one with the pricey PS5 DualSense Edge controller itself. Yesterday, we reported that the PS1-themed cable connector housing blocks one of the USB ports on the console. Now, players are pointing out that the DualSense Edge stick modules come in a unique color that isn’t available to purchase separately. At least not yet.

 Sony might not sell PS5 DualSense controller stick modules in 30th anniversary color 
I have yet to receive my 30th anniversary controller, but Redditors have been sharing photos of the Edge controller showcasing the color difference between the special edition sticks and the regular stick modules. Worth pointing out that it’s hard enough to procure the standard stick modules since they aren’t mass produced and regularly go out of stock, so players aren’t confident that Sony will be offering this unique color.

In the images below, the color difference between the standard and special stick modules is very noticeable. Should players need to replace the component, not only will the controller lose value, it won’t be aesthetically pleasing.


It might be possible in the future to get unofficial replacements in the special edition color, but for now, players can only hope that their controllers don’t suffer from stick drift.

author: VNExplorer
title: Equipos de emergencias piden que no llames para hacer bromas; NO es gracioso
text:
no hagas llamadas de broma a equipos de emergencia
Equipos de emergencia como Bomberos, la Secretaría de Seguridad, Cruz Roja y otros recuerda a los mexicanos que el número 911 es solo para emergencias, exhortan a EVITAR realizar bromas en este Día de los Santos Inocentes.
Los servicios de emergencia detallan que algunas personas acostumbran a hacer llamados ‘fake’ en este día en el que se acostumbra hacer bromas a amigos, familiares y otras personas.
Pero en el caso de las personas que trabajan brindando apoyo a situaciones de emergencia no es agradable recibir este tipo de llamadas falsas.
“¡Alguien puede necesitar de nuestra ayuda!” señaló la Cruz Roja en sus redes sociales.
DÍA DE LOS SANTOS INOCENTES El Día de los Santos Inocentes es una celebración que tiene lugar el 28 de diciembre en varios países de habla hispana.
La fecha conmemora un episodio bíblico narrado en el Evangelio de Mateo, en el que el rey Herodes ordena la matanza de todos los niños menores de dos años en Belén con el fin de eliminar al recién nacido Jesús, a quien consideraba una amenaza para su reinado. Los niños asesinados en este acto son conocidos como los “Santos Inocentes”.
En la actualidad, el Día de los Santos Inocentes se celebra de manera más ligera y festiva. Las personas juegan bromas y trucos a sus amigos y familiares, y los medios de comunicación suelen publicar noticias falsas para divertir a la audiencia. Es un día en el que la gente está más abierta a recibir bromas y no se toma en serio la información que se comparte, ya que es tradicionalmente un día de humor y diversión.
Aunque las bromas suelen ser inofensivas y en tono de juego, es crucial considerar los sentimientos y límites de los demás para evitar situaciones incómodas o desagradables.
*bb

author: Naira Trindade
title: ANTT multa empresas de ônibus durante transição para novas regras
text:
A ANTT decidiu multar empresas de transporte interestadual de ônibus durante o processo de implantação do novo marco regulatório do setor. A medida foi tomada contra orientação da área técnica, que havia proposto fiscalização educativa durante o processo de transição de regras. A decisão gerou incômodo nas viações prestadoras do serviço, que alegam necessitar de prazo para as mudanças.
O marco entrou em vigor em fevereiro, prevendo seis meses de adaptação (até agosto). A norma prevê, entre outras atividades, que os fiscais monitorem indicadores de qualidade, realizem inspeções nas companhias, verifiquem as condições de veículos e pontos de venda, vistoriem o transporte de itens proibidos ou que ofereçam risco à segurança.
A agência está autorizada a aplicar penalidades, mas, em parecer enviado em abril à Diretoria Colegiada da ANTT, a Superintendência de Serviços de Transporte Rodoviário de Passageiros pediu que a postura educativa fosse adotada para assegurar “uma transição suave” aos envolvidos.
O órgão explicou que, por ora, ainda tem feito workshops e preparando cartilhas para ampliar o conhecimento sobre as regras. Por isso, argumentou, seria necessário pausar as multas baseadas na nova norma até agosto, sem prejuízo de aplicar aquelas que são fundamentadas em dispositivos pregressos.
Rafael Vitale, diretor-geral da ANTT, concordou com a área técnica e, em 16 de abril, determinou que a aplicação de penalidades fosse suspensa. Porém, em 23 do mesmo mês, ele recuou da decisão e restabeleceu as punições. Justificou que a Diretoria Colegiada, reunida para tratar do tema, aprovou só os trechos do parecer da Supas que não tratavam da mudança de postura dos fiscais em campo. O cavalo-de-pau na orientação irritou as empresas de ônibus.
[Mais recente](#) Próxima CFM pede à Anvisa medidas para reduzir riscos com procedimentos estéticos
Inscreva-se na Newsletter: Lauro Jardim

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Maryland weather: Sunny skies expected Thursday in Baltimore; chance of rain ahead
text: Another sunny and warm day is expected Thursday in the Baltimore area following heavy midweek rain. Temperatures are forecast to reach a high of 53 degrees on Thursday, according to the National Weather Service, which expects the sunny day to be accompanied by light winds ahead of the next bout of rain to come Friday afternoon. The coldest air mass so far this winter is expected at the start of next week. Heavy rain and fast winds on Tuesday caused flooding and power outages, peaking at 60,400 outages affecting Baltimore Gas and Electric Co. customers, the utility company said. Most of those outages had been fixed by Wednesday, and about 2,400 customers were still affected by outages Thursday morning. A chance of rain is forecast to begin after 4 p.m. Friday, possibly totaling between a half and three-quarters of an inch and developing into thunderstorms into the night. The shoreline in Anne Arundel County, which saw heavy flooding Tuesday and Wednesday in Annapolis, is again under a coastal flood watch from late Friday night into early Saturday morning, as the weather service expected an increased threat of moderate tidal floods. Rain is predicted to stop Saturday morning for a long weekend free of precipitation. January’s precipitation totals for the area, swelled by Tuesday’s rainfall, are already beyond average, though a lack of snowfall this winter could end early next week. Chances of snow are forecast for early Tuesday morning through Tuesday night as cold air moves in, though it’s not yet known how much will fall.

author: Chris Hughes
title: Terrifying global conflicts to get worse in 2024 - what you need to know - World News - Mirror Online
text:
As wars rage across the Middle East and Ukraine , the prospect for a more peaceful year in 2024 remains bleak.
Global rivals have taken sides, linking up the two main conflicts and furthering the risk of wider violence. The Israel - Hamas struggle is backed by the US -led West, with Iran providing aid to Israel’s foes, including Hamas and Hezbollah. Russia is thought to have done deals with Iran and China – and even North Korea . And the UK and the rest of NATO is supporting Kyiv’s struggle for survival against Moscow’s invasion.
Experts fear the Red Sea will be a new focus of trouble, due to Iran-backed Houthis attacking Western shipping. And Iran yesterday underlined its goal of wiping out Israel after one of its top commanders was killed in a strike on Syrian capital Damascus. It came as Israel tries to stop Iran giving arms to terrorists attacking it.
Here, we analyse the main conflicts and risks directly affecting the UK...
Israel/Gaza Israel’s war against Hamas is set to rage past the summer.
But the US is desperate to persuade it not to launch ground attacks on Hezbollah on its northern frontier, which could explode if the West Bank, Lebanon, Iran and its proxies in Yemen hit back.
The diplomacy push is hampered by PM Benjamin Netanyahu’s right-wing government and its stance following the October Hamas atrocities against civilians.
Ukraine Ukraine is struggling to make significant inroads in its counter-offensive but Russia’s forces have taken an almighty beating.
Winter slows fighting but Kyiv now has F16 jets and superior missiles.
This advantage could mean victory or at least force Putin to offer a deal.
A compromise would mean Kyiv losing territory but allow both sides to celebrate a partial victory.
North Korea Kim Jong-un has again told his military to “accelerate” war preparations and is likely to continue weapons testing.
This is likely a bluff by the dictator, rather than a serious threat – but the US, which has more than 25,000 troops in South Korea, is monitoring the situation.
While the West does not really know Kim’s intentions – and this prediction could bite back – nuclear-armed North Korea remains a sideshow.
China Intelligence agencies say while Russia is like a storm to be dealt with now, China is a longer-term threat more akin to climate change.
Beijing’s ambition to re-absorb Taiwan is probably not possible for a few years, so a Chinese assault on the island nation remains very unlikely in 2024.
But if and when it comes, the conflict will be bloody for both sides and change the geopolitical landscape.
Iran Iran is a headache for US as it supports the terror groups fighting and threatening Israel – Hamas, Hezbollah and the Yemeni Houthis.
The Houthi drones threat to Red Sea shipping must be tackled and the US has updated plans for attacking Iran directly. Yesterday, the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corp vowed to wipe out Israel after the burial of Razi Mousavi, a general killed in an air strike in Syria.
Guyana The UK is sending warship HMS Trent to support the ex-colony against a threat from Venezuela, which aims to annex the oil and mineral-rich Essequibo region.
With Guyana booming and Venezuela’s economy ailing, the latter’s President Maduro is under pressure, so this is one to watch. Israel’s war against Hamas is set to rage past the summer.
But the US is desperate to persuade it not to launch ground attacks on Hezbollah on its northern frontier, which could explode if the West Bank, Lebanon, Iran and its proxies in Yemen hit back.
The diplomacy push is hampered by PM Benjamin Netanyahu’s right-wing government and its stance following the October Hamas atrocities against civilians.

author: @ladepechedumidi
title: Larra. Aventure écourtée pour le café Imago - ladepeche.fr
text:
Larra. Aventure écourtée pour le café Imago
Ouvert le 6 juillet 2024, le café Imago s’apprêtait à fêter son premier anniversaire. Mais l’ambiance est aujourd’hui à la désillusion. Les gérants Didier et Wanda, annoncent leur départ imminent, évoquant "des pressions et entraves ayant fragilisé la viabilité financière du lieu".
Présenté en réunion publique le 6 juin 2024 avec l’association 1 000 Cafés et la mairie, le projet avait suscité enthousiasme et engagement. Pourtant, malgré une mise en œuvre fidèle aux principes annoncés, "les tensions ont rapidement compromis son bon déroulement", estiment les gérants. Ces derniers employés par 1 000 Cafés, déplore une transition subie. La mairie, liée au projet par un bail commercial, dit, par le biais de son premier édile Jean-Louis Moign avoir été mise devant le fait accompli.
Elle espère une reprise rapide du bail pour garantir la continuité du lieu. Le café pourrait ne pas rouvrir avant fermeture définitive. Un départ amer pour une aventure pourtant portée par l’envie de créer du lien.

author: archyde
title: Luis Arráez Powers San Diego to Milestone 80th Victory
text:
“`html
Luis Arraez Shines in San Diego Padres’ Victory Over Detroit Tigers September 4, 2024
A masterful season is being experienced by Venezuelan Luis⁢ Arraez , who connected a pair of hits that places him in ‌second place for the most ⁢games with two or ‌more hits in MLB 2024 . His performance‍ contributed ⁢to the San Diego ‍Padres securing a thrilling victory against the Detroit Tigers with a ⁤final score of 6×5 .
In the matchup held at⁣ Petco Park , Luis Arraez took the‍ field as both⁢ the leadoff and‍ designated hitter. Over five⁢ at-bats, he achieved two‌ hits, scored ‌once ‌(72), successfully stole one base⁢ (9), and drew one walk (22). His batting average ⁢soared⁣ to .311, leading the National League and surpassing rival Marcell ‌Ozuna , who sits at .305.
Moreover, ‍ Arraez ‌ has now⁤ accumulated 54 multi-hit games in the current 2024 season, which ​is the second-best record in Major ​League⁢ Baseball ( MLB ),​ trailing only Bobby Witt Jr. (57) and ahead of stars like Shohei Ohtani , Aaron Judge , and Francisco Lindor , ​who all have 49.
Luis Arraez Leads the⁢ Padres to Victory Arraez’s first offensive opportunity came ⁤at the end of the first inning, where he faced his fellow Venezuelan, Keider Montero , ‍who managed to field a ⁢ground ⁢ball for the first​ out.
In the final ‌part of the third inning, with the score at⁤ 3-0, Arraez struggled against a 95.8 MPH⁤ fastball, resulting in another out as ⁤the shortstop made ​the play.
With⁢ the game⁢ tight at 5-3, Luis Arraez returned to bat in the fifth inning. This time, he adapted and executed a well-placed line drive to the opposite field, marking his first hit. He later scored after contributions from Fernando Tatis⁢ Jr. and Manny Machado , leveling the score at five.
Following⁤ that at-bat, Arraez​ faced a new pitcher, Beau Brieske , and‌ successfully delivered his second ⁢hit, sending‌ it through the center at 99 MPH. In a‌ moment of aggressive base running, he‍ advanced‌ to second base, bringing his total ⁢stolen bases to⁤ nine.
In his last two at-bats, Luis ⁢Arraez hit⁣ a⁢ ground⁢ ball in the seventh inning and‍ was granted‍ an ‍automatic walk in the bottom of ⁢the tenth ‌inning.
With his two hits in this game, the talented player ‍has now achieved‍ a total of 173⁢ hits (leading the‍ National ‍League) and 214 total bases.
“`
html
h, Arraez showcased his exceptional batting skills, recording two crucial hits that helped propel his team to win. His consistency at the plate has now earned him a spot among the league leaders, solidifying his reputation as one of the premier hitters in baseball this season.
The game unfolded with the Padres taking an early lead, but the Tigers fought back, making it a nail-biting contest. With the score tied late in the game, Arraez's timely hits were instrumental in bringing home the victory for San Diego.
The win not only boosts the Padres’ playoff hopes but also highlights Arraez’s impressive ability to perform under pressure. As the season progresses, fans and analysts alike are keeping an eye on the star player to see if he can maintain his exceptional form.
This victory marks another milestone for the Padres, who continue to chase their postseason ambitions. As for Arraez, he remains focused on contributing to his team's success and further enhancing his status as one of Major League Baseball's standout players.
